title: Country likely to have pronatalist policies

content.question: Which of the following country demographics would be used to explain the need for the pronatalist policies shown?

choices.label: A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="43" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>43</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="3.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, passes a law that requires paid maternity leave.

A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="negative 0.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , legislates tax credits for working parents

A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="16" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, establishes long maternity leave periods from work

A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="0.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, requires full-day kindergarten.

A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="1.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> , provides state-subsidized day care centers.

content.answer: A country with a birth rate of <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a death rate of <math alttext="13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a rate of natural increase of <math alttext="negative 0.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> , legislates tax credits for working parents

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain a likely outcome in a geographic scenario using geographic concepts, processes, models, or theories.
